title: Ventura Oilers
text:
The Ventura Oilers were a <a href="California%20League">California League</a> baseball team based in <a href="Ventura%2C%20California">Ventura, California</a>, USA that played from 1947 to 1953. They were affiliated with the <a href="San%20Francisco%20Seals%20%28baseball%29">San Francisco Seals</a> of the <a href="Pacific%20Coast%20League">Pacific Coast League</a> in 1953, the <a href="Boston%20Braves%20%28baseball%29">Boston Braves</a> from 1950 to 1952 and the <a href="New%20York%20Yankees">New York Yankees</a> from 1947 to 1949 and played their home games at <a href="Babe%20Ruth%20Field">Babe Ruth Field</a>.
Notable players for the Ventura Oilers include <a href="Dick%20Adams%20%28baseball%29">Dick Adams</a>, <a href="Dario%20Lodigiani">Dario Lodigiani</a> and <a href="Dave%20Melton">Dave Melton</a>. Lodigiani also managed the team.
Bat Boys for the team included Robert and Frank Buck.
Notable <a href="major%20league%20baseball">major league</a> players that played for the Ventura Braves included <a href="Gene%20Lillard">Gene Lillard</a>, <a href="Bob%20Roselli">Bob Roselli</a> and <a href="Bobby%20Sturgeon">Bobby Sturgeon</a>. Lillard and Sturgeon also managed the Ventura team.
The team became the <a href="Channel%20Cities%20Oilers">Channel Cities Oilers</a> in 1954 and then the <a href="Reno%20Silver%20Sox">Reno Silver Sox</a> in 1955.
